Articles.Content: you can also run mapgen using texture or texture polar as arguments to regenerate the GUI map.
Sorry for my lack of knowledge in programming and that stuff, but how do you add the command lines? By the way, very good addon!
Sorry for my lack of knowledge in programming and stuff, but how do you add the command lines? I've been trying to figure out, but i cant seem to find it.

If you don't know how to use the console, just make a text file file with content

 isa_mapgen.exe [arguments]

save in plugindata\isa_mapsat with file extension .bat and double-click it.
I love this!!! its been a major part of my missions to Mun and Minimus. i have two orbiters whom are mapping both minimus and the mun right now!, i am very impressed, well done
Thanks a lot! It worked perfectly! And what if I knew how to use the console?
go to your pluginData\isa_mapsat folder, then type the same as you whould do in a batch file (batch files are just scripts made with console commands).

This doesn't seem to work for me. I've had a satellite in a polar orbit around kerbin, and while doing other missions (at no more than 10x speed) it gathers no data. It only seems to gather when I'm focused/flying it; Is this intentional, a bug or a setting I'm missing?
That's how it works; there's not currently a way to collect data from satellites which are not part of the active flight.

Ah, oh well. I'll just continue leaving KSP running in the background with a satellite going around.

It's working really well, I love the balance between having to scout by eye for artefacts and just looking up a map. It's also nice to be able to launch satellites with a use.
It's good and all, but I don't like the fact that it deletes whatever's been generated when the ship is unfocused. A whole night's worth of data is gone.
Cepheus, there is a toggle option on the mapper UI for Storing Raw Data. Unfortunately the option is disabled by default, something I hope is changed in the next release.
I have it toggled to 'On,' and I can actually see what it creates in plugin data. However, when I unfocus, then refocus the ship, it deletes the file.
Where do I put the isa_MapSat.cs file?
You don't actually need that; it's just the sourcecode, so it is not required for the plugin to work.

I have it toggled to 'On,' and I can actually see what it creates in plugin data. However, when I unfocus, then refocus the ship, it deletes the file.

That's odd. There's a known bug that deletes the gui map images, but i've never had it deleted the csv files where it stores the raw data.

Edited August 13, 2012 by rkman
FYI, this is the mod that Chickenkeeper24 uses in his videos. Got a polar orbit!

Once in awhile the maps I've collected get seriously corrupted (see attached image). This is, I believe, the third time it's occurred. I don't notice any problems while playing, but the next time I open the game all my maps are hosed. Even if I don't access a mapsat orbiting a given body, the maps for that planet are wiped too--I don't even have a mapsat around Minmus anymore but the map is gone.

The game didn't crash prior to the maps getting wiped. I quit the game gracefully by going back to the main menu and exiting. The debug console shows no errors.

The .csv files are all okay and maps generated from that data are normal.

Is it possible to convert the .csv files into the main "gui_Kerbin_ISA_Topo.png" maps, or are they lost for good?

I've had the same thing happen, every time I've tried to use this mod. None of my maps "in game" last long, they always wind up looking as you posted...although the .csv files are ok.

From command line or batch file input the following to regenerate gui maps (it's best if KSP is closed altogether):

isa_MapGen.exe texture

isa_MapGen.exe texture polar

Easiest way is to just start a text file in your isa_mapsat plugin data folder, put those two lines in, and then change the .txt to .bat.
Excellent, thanks.

Hey, itÃ‚Â´s me again. I tried doing a polar map, but the azimuthalNP/SP donÃ‚Â´t seem to be working properly, it doesnÃ‚Â´t recognize the commands, it just renders an ISA map, and if I write the command "polar", and a number, both hemispheres appear to overlay. How do I get a polar map, then?

Just found a bug.

ISA MapSat worked fine for a few weeks until today i checked my map, and it was all gray. I lost all my progress.
i just used your plugin and it is awesome just wanted to show my map i made over the span of 6 hrs.

Just found a bug.

ISA MapSat worked fine for a few weeks until today i checked my map, and it was all gray. I lost all my progress.

From command line or batch file input the following to regenerate gui maps (it's best if KSP is closed altogether):

isa_MapGen.exe texture

isa_MapGen.exe texture polar

Easiest way is to just start a text file in your isa_mapsat plugin data folder, put those two lines in, and then change the .txt to .bat.
